messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([0-9]+,\s*)*[0-9]+'

Imagine a castle with 15 rooms. Room 1 is connected to room 7, room 10, room 13, and room 11. Room 2 is connected to room 5, room 8, room 11, and room 14. Room 3 is connected to room 6, room 9, room 12, and room 8. Room 4 is connected to room 7, room 10, room 13, and room 15. Room 5 is connected to room 8, room 11, and room 14. Room 6 is connected to room 9, room 12, and room 15. Room 7 is connected to room 10, and room 13. Room 8 is connected to room 14. Room 9 is connected to room 12 and room 15. Room 10 is connected to room 13. Room 11 is connected to room 14. Room 12 is connected to room 15. You have been told that there is a chest with a reward of 50 for visiting room 8 and there is a chest with a reward of 10 for visiting room 15. Now, from room 1 what is the shortest path that yields the most reward? Remember that you can collect the reward only once and only from one chest. Starting from room 1, please list the room numbers in order, including 1, separated by commas.

To submit the result, it is very important to format the output properly. You should submit the result with a newline at the end.

This is a popularity contest, so the number of upvotes on your final result will determine your score. The winner will be the one with the highest score.

In case of a tie, the one with more upvotes on the earlier submissions will be declared the winner.

I am afraid, we cannot guarantee a 100% upvote. However, we will do our best to upvote the most deserving submissions.

All accepted submissions qualify for the final round. The final round will be held on the last day of the contest. The final round submissions should follow the same format as the regular round submissions.

I will also select one of the final round submissions as the best submission of the contest. This will be the submission that has the most efficient algorithm and is the shortest in size. The author of the best submission will get a 10% upvote on the submission with the highest number of upvotes in the regular round.

Only one submission per author is allowed. You can, however, use the same algorithm in multiple languages.

You can try to improve your

Now you have been told that the reward of the chest in room 8 has been changed to 12 and the reward of the chest in room 15 has been changed to 48. Now, from room 1 what is the shortest path that yields the most reward? Remember that you can collect the reward only once and only from one chest. Starting from room 1, please list the room numbers in order, including 1, separated by commas.

This is the first task of this kind that I've solved. I've used some code that I've written in the past, which is a bit rusty, but still seems to work. I think it's not optimal, but I'm pretty happy with the result.

I've put my code on GitHub. It's just an iframe, so I can't put it on pastebin. I've also uploaded my solution in text format. I've used the following commands to compile it to an executable:

I'm really excited to see what other people have done! I'd love to hear what they think of my solution.

Edit: I forgot to mention, but I've also uploaded the executable in text format, so you can run it from the command line if you want.

A little late, but here's my submission for the first task. I had to run this code a couple of times before I got the correct output.

I wrote my own program to solve this task. It's not really a brute force solution, but I did have to use some brute force in the end to get the correct answer. I used Python 3 and PyBrain for this task.

For the
